name: slowness

slowness noun [U]
(LACK OF SPEED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of moving or happening without much speed: He moved with excruciating slowness. They expressed impatience with the slowness of the pace of change.

slowness noun [U]
(LACK OF EXCITEMENT)

slowness noun [U]
(LACK OF INTELLIGENCE)
an inability to understand or notice things quickly : Forrest was a little slow, however his slowness could easily be classified as naiveness. He credited his greatest breakthroughs to his slowness , saying that by making sense of things at a later age than most children, he was able to apply a more developed intellect.
